intro: Oldenlandia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are typically hairy and opposite, contributing to its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in disturbed soils. The plant is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and medicinal plants.
